content:
MKSAP 19 Digital is a package that includes a feature-rich online application and a collection of mobile apps that enable you to work offline and later sync your answers. The online application includes the entirety of content in the 18th edition of MKSAP, including 1200 pre-tested multiple-choice questions and hundreds of pages of updated information in the field of internal medicine, organized into subspecialty sections. MKSAP 19 Digital is a state-of-the-art learning system, enabling learners to have unprecedented control and unparalleled ease of use. Learn more about MKSAP 19 Digital and the entire MKSAP 19 product suite.

About the Program Leadership and Editorial Team

MKSAP 19 was conceived and produced within the American College of Physicians Medical Education Division under the general leadership of Davoren Chick, MD, FACP, Senior Vice President; Patrick Alguire, MD, FACP, Senior Vice President Emeritus and MKSAP 19 Editor-in-Chief; Sean McKinney, Vice President; and Margaret Wells, Director of Self-Assessment and Educational Programs. Becky Krumm, Managing Editor, oversaw content development, managed production, and managed the MKSAP 19 editorial team. Julia Nawrocki, Digital Content Associate/Editor, coordinated the MKSAP 19 Digital quality assurance and production processes.

Davoren Chick, MD, FACP, Denise M. Dupras, MD, PhD, FACP, Robert L. Trowbridge, Jr., MD, FACP, and Richard S. Eisenstaedt, MD, MACP, served as Deputy Editors.

Editorial and Administrative Team:

  • Ellen McDonald, PhD, Senior Staff Editor
  • Jackie Twomey, Senior Staff Editor
  • Megan Zborowski, Senior Staff Editor
  • Randy Hendrickson, Production Administrator/Editor
  • Julia Nawrocki, Digital Content Associate/Editor
  • Linnea Donnarumma, Staff Editor
  • Chuck Emig, Staff Editor
  • Suzanne Meyers, Staff Editor
  • Joysa Winter, Staff Editor
  • Valerie A. Dangovetsky, Administrator
  • Kimberly Kerns, Administrative Coordinator

Additional information about editorial and program management team members is available in Contributors and Disclosures.

Graphic Design Team:

  • Barry Moshinski, Director, Graphic Services
  • Michael Ripca, Graphics Technical Administrator
  • Jennifer Gropper, Graphic Designer

About the Developers

MKSAP 19 Digital was developed within the American College of Physicians Digital Products and Services department, under the general leadership of Steve Spadt, Senior Vice President, Technology. Brian Sweigard, Director of Digital Products and Services, led the design and development effort and served as overall project manager. Dan Hoffmann, Director of Information Technology, served as primary liaison with infrastructure and systems teams. Senior Architects Neil Kohl and Chris Patterson led the overall architecture and construction of the infrastructure on which this product securely resides.

Software Design and Development Team:

  • Dan Barron, Senior Web Application Developer/Architect
  • Chris Forrest, Senior Software Developer
  • Kathleen Hoover, Senior Web Developer
  • Scott Hurd, Manager, Content Systems
  • Brad Lord, Senior Web Application Developer/Architect
  • John McKnight, Senior Web Developer
  • Kara Regis, Manager, User Interface Design and Development
